arm_group.description: Control Group (Arm 1): Children randomised to the control group will receive 24-months of current model of specialist CF care.

Intervention group (Arm 2):  Children randomised to the intervention group will receive 24-months of current model of specialist CF care PLUS a weekly structured, individually prescribed and personally supervised exercise intervention at a local fitness facility or at school.

brief_summary.textblock:
The primary aim of the research is to evaluate whether an alternative model of cystic
      fibrosis (CF) physiotherapy care can produce statistically significant improvements in
      clinical and patient reported outcomes, and whether this alternative model is economically
      advantageous and/or sustainable.

      Children randomised to the control group will receive 24-months of current model of CF care
      at Great Ormond Street Hospital (GOSH).

      Children randomised to the intervention group will receive 24-months of current model of CF
      care at GOSH PLUS a weekly structured, individually prescribed and personally supervised
      exercise intervention at a local fitness facility or at school. The exercise prescription
      will include aerobic, anaerobic, strength, core conditioning and stretching components.

      The main objectives of the study are:

        1. Determine differences, if any, in lung function between the two groups;

        2. Determine differences, if any, in exercise capacity between the two groups;

        3. Evaluate cost of care of alternate model of care versus current model of care.

clinical_study.brief_title: INSPIRE-CF: an Alternative Physiotherapy Model for Children With Cystic Fibrosis

intervention.description: The exercise intervention will include aerobic, anaerobic, strength, core conditioning and stretching components.

facility.name: Great Ormond Street Hospital for Children NHS Foundation Trust

clinical_study.official_title: INSPIRE-CF: A Randomised Controlled Trial Investigating the Clinical and Economic Benefits of an Alternative Model of Physiotherapy Care for Children With Cystic Fibrosis

overall_official.affiliation: Cystic Fibrosis Unit, Great Ormond Street Hospital for Children NHS Foundation Trust
Institute of Child Health, University College London

primary_outcome.description: Spirometry data will also to be collected at outpatient clinics, annual reviews and during hospital admissions.
primary_outcome.measure: Forced expiratory volume in one second (FEV1)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Gold standard exercise test to determine peak oxygen uptake during exercise
Field test to assess functional exercise capacity. Distance covered and incremental level changes are evaluated over time.
Multiple breath washout test to evaluate for changes in small airways
Height, weight and body mass index will be measured at regular intervals to evaluate for changes in growth parameters
secondary_outcome.measure: Height, weight, body mass index measurements

secondary_outcome.description: Disease specific questionnaire to evaluate changes in quality of life in cystic fibrosis
Evaluate differences in cost of care between the current model of CF care and the alternative model of care; and cost per patient.

clinical_study.source: Great Ormond Street Hospital for Children NHS Foundation Trust

lead_sponsor.agency: Great Ormond Street Hospital for Children NHS Foundation Trust

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
